definition: abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
surname Wei
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
legislative elections

sentences.english: The Yunlin lawmaker says the KMT's campaign strategist doesn't understand southern issues.
sentences.chinese: 云林立委说，国民党竞选决策者不了解南部的议题。

sentences.english: Yeh was also found guilty of leaking secrets to a lawmaker in a separate case.
sentences.chinese: 叶盛茂也在另一件案子里泄密给一位立委，判决有罪。

sentences.english: For her dual citizenship, the court found Stella Lee guilty of fraud and not corruption.
sentences.chinese: 立委李庆安双重国籍案，法院以诈欺罪判二年。

sentences.english: That out-spoken legislator went out on a limb when he declared his support for drug using.
sentences.chinese: 这敢言立委时就大不讳，他宣布他支持药物使用。

sentences.english: Taiwan's legislators had many heated debates at its meetings.
sentences.chinese: 台湾立委开会时，有多次激烈的辩论。

definition: Legislative Yuan, the legislative branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
People First Party, Taiwan
Ko Wen-je (1959-), Taiwanese independent politician, Mayor of Taipei City from 2014
member of the Legislative Yuan (Tw)
Executive Yuan, the executive branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China from 2016
Chen Chi-mai (1964-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
Hung Hsiu-chu (1948-), Taiwanese KMT politician
Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会
Su Tseng-chang (1947-), Taiwanese DPP politician, premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
Eric Chu (1961-), Taiwanese KMT politician
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
